statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description:
Jamar Lewis had 16 points and 12
rebounds to lead Grambling State to a 50-49 win over Mississippi
Valley State on Thursday in the quarterfinals of the Southwestern
Athletic Conference tournament.
article.headline: Grambling State advances with one-point win
article.linkText: Grambling State advances with one-point win
article.story: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. (AP) -- Jamar Lewis had 16 points and 12 rebounds to lead Grambling State to a 50-49 win over Mississippi Valley State on Thursday in the quarterfinals of the Southwestern Athletic Conference tournament. Jesse Taylor missed the second of two free throws with 17 seconds left and missed a jump shot with 3 seconds remaining for Mississippi Valley. Grambling State (14-12) will play the Alabama A&M-Arkansas Pine Bluff winner on Friday night for a berth in the championship game. Anthony Williams and Donte' Gordon contributed 12 points apiece for the Tigers. Grambling was without SWAC Player of the Year Brion Rush, who sat out the game with a foot injury. Taylor had 13 points to lead MVSU (9-19). MVSU shot 47 percent, but made just 4-of-14 free throws and 3-of-12 3-pointers.
